humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that the largest focus of invasion of the invasive ductal carcinoma is 2.5 cm in greatest dimension. Based on the rules provided, a T2 tumor is more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm. Therefore, the pathologic T stage of the patient's cancer is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage of a cancer is determined by the size of the primary tumor. In this report, the size of the largest focus of invasion is measured to be 2.5 cm. According to the TNM staging system, a T2 stage is given to tumors that are greater than 2 cm in size but not greater than 5 cm in size. Therefore, the T stage for this patient's cancer is T2.
